title: SB1421/SB16 DA "Memos" San Bernardino DA

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SB1421/SB16 DA "Memos" San Bernardino DA
communications.communication:
Mr. Schultze, 

To simplify our case, I am submitting a new request for the release of records under the California Public Records Act, Gov’t Code §§ 7920.000 et seq., California Penal Code §§832.7-832.8, and Art. I, § 3(b) of the California Constitution.  I seek copies of all records in your office’s possession, regardless of who created them. This request is for all District Attorney’s Office “investigative reports,” which you call “memoranda,” summarizing your office’s investigations and conclusions regarding 165 officer-involved shootings and other use-of-force incidents resulting in serious bodily injury or death occurring in San Bernardino County between 2014-2024 listed in the attached csv. It includes incidents previously identified by your office, which are labeled in the “Data From” column as “DA List.” 

Please respond to this request in ten days, either by providing the requested information or providing a written response setting forth the specific legal authority on which you rely in failing to disclose each requested record, or by specifying a date in the near future to respond to the request. See Cal. Gov’t Code § 7922. Pursuant to section 7922.600, please disclose all reasonably segregable non-exempt information from any portions of records you claim are exempt from disclosure.

If any records requested above are available in electronic format, please provide them in an electronic format, as provided in Govt. Code § 7922.570. To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, we ask that you make records available to us as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.     
 
Thank you for your assistance with this routine request.
 
Sincerely,
 
Katey Rusch
Reporter, Investigative Reporting Program at UC-Berkeley
(510) 516-6277

title: Public Records Request – Police Surveillance, Investigations & Reports (Henderson Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public Records Request – Police Surveillance, Investigations & Reports
I am submitting this public records request under the Nevada Public Records Act (NRS 239.010) to obtain records regarding police surveillance, investigations, or law enforcement activity related to me.

I am requesting copies of the following records from 1/1/22-present.
	1.	Surveillance Logs & Reports:
	•	Any police records, logs, or reports of surveillance conducted on me or my residence.
	•	Any logs documenting law enforcement presence near 147 carriage way west, Henderson nv 89074, lake Las Vegas, 
	•	Any footage from body cameras or dashboard cameras of officers who have patrolled near my residence.
	2.	Unmarked Police Vehicles Monitoring Me:
	•	Any records, dispatch logs, or internal communications regarding the use of unmarked police vehicles in my area.
	•	Any records that show an official reason for police vehicles monitoring me or my home.
	3.	Investigations or Complaints Filed Against Me:
	•	Any open or closed investigations in which I am listed as a suspect, witness, or person of interest.
	•	Any 911 calls or police reports made about me, my vehicle, or my home.
	•	Any official complaints filed against me that resulted in police action.
	4.	Communications Involving My Name or Address:
	•	Any internal emails, text messages, memos, or reports exchanged between officers, city officials, or the municipal court regarding me.
	•	Any records of surveillance authorizations or stakeout orders involving my name.

If any portion of this request is denied or exempt from disclosure, please provide a written explanation with specific legal citations under Nevada law.

If there are any fees for processing this request, please notify me before proceeding. Otherwise, I request a fee waiver, as this request is in the public interest and pertains to potential law enforcement misconduct.

Expected Response Time: I expect a response within 5 business days per Nevada Public Records Law (NRS 239.0107).

2. Request for Henderson Municipal Court & Judicial Records

Subject: Public Records Request – Henderson Municipal Court Activity & Communications

Dear City of Henderson Clerk’s Office,

Under the Nevada Public Records Act (NRS 239.010), I am requesting access to records involving my name, my residence, and any court-related actions taken against me.

Specifically, I request:
	1.	Records of Any Court Actions, Orders, or Investigations:
	•	Any subpoenas, warrants, or court orders issued in my name.
	•	Any court documents where I am listed as a party, witness, or subject of interest.
	2.	Judicial Surveillance or Investigations Against Me:
	•	Any records of court-ordered surveillance, tracking, or monitoring related to me or my residence.
	•	Any municipal court documents related to ongoing investigations involving me.
	3.	Communications Related to Me:
	•	Any emails, memos, or other correspondence from Henderson judges, clerks, prosecutors, or police officers discussing me.
	•	Any internal or external communications about me, including requests for court-ordered monitoring, tracking, or follow-ups.
	4.	Municipal Court Records of Fines, Citations, or Hearings:
	•	Any court records, citations, or fines related to CASEY ANN CAMPBELL, POBOX 937 Forestville CA 95436, 147 Carriage Way West Henderson NV 89074, 707-623-6176, DMV CAD7157427
	•	Any scheduled or past court hearings where I am listed as a party or involved individual.

If any part of my request is denied or redacted, please provide a legal explanation under Nevada law.

If fees apply, please notify me before processing. However, I request a fee waiver due to the public interest of this request.

Expected Response Time: I expect a response within 5 business days as required by NRS 239.0107.


 Police Department (Surveillance & Investigations Request):
	•	Email: HPDrecords@cityofhenderson.com
	•	Mail: Henderson Police Department - Records Division, 223 Lead St, Henderson, NV 89015

Municipal Court (Judicial & Court Records Request):
	•	Email: cityclerk@cityofhenderson.com
	•	Mail: City of Henderson Clerk’s Office, 240 S. Water St, Henderson, NV 89015

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Casey Campbell

title: NIL Records 2

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

During the September executive session Maj. Gen Wins briefed: "There was an out of house consortium that was created and there are some alumni who recognizing kind of how fast this thing is moving, they went and got involved in this consortium where they are some cadet athletes, basketball players. There's an agreement on them here. Now there's two other features that are separate from the NIL. There's an Academic Achievement Fund, which we did. Okay. And the Academic Achievement Fund is set up in such a way where if you stay at VMI and you perform academically at a certain level, right, then you would get a sum of money and I'm pretty sure academic achievement was upon graduation. There's a second one that's called the Austin Fund which operates similarly. Okay. And I know that that one is upon graduation you would get this the equivalent of I believe $5,000 a year. Right. For four years. So when you graduate in four years, the Austin fund would get you somewhere about $20,000. You have those, those two arrangements as well, which we are participating in right now. It largely affects only basketball. It largely only affects basketball." He also briefed that the budget projection is based on increased ticket sales. He also mentioned "Jamal" attended a Keydet Club meeting covering the NIL and consortiuum and has the slides and other materials from that. This FOIA requests 

1. Records showing the struture, operations and policies of the NIL consortiuum Maj. Gen. Wins Mentioned. Again, these records include Keydet Club and Alumni Agencies slides, documents, agreements, and other materials given to him that, as a result, become discloseable Public Records.
2. Records showing the amunt paid out of the Academic Achievement Fund since its creation and THE SOURCE OF THOSE FUNDS (student fees, donors (who?), state funds, etc.).
3. Records showing how much, if anything, cadets are charged or any funds form cadet athletic or other student fees for admission to or their attendence at NCAA Football and NCAA basketball events regardless if these are considered "tickets" or not for the past 2 academic years.

#1 and especially #3 should be readily available and should not take more than the 5 day maximum. I am willing to accept any of these immediately available rather than wait for all records if needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Lafayette Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alin Beane

title: Superintendent's Evaluation

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Superintendent's Evaluation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records showing the expectations, goals and other criteria used by the Virginia Military Institute Board of Visitors (BOV) to evaluate the perfrmance and create the required performance appraisal of Gen. Peay for his last year as Superintendent and for Maj. Gen. Wins each of his years as Superintendent to include, without limitation, the most current version.

According to the BOV ByLaws: "It shall define its expectations and set goals for the Superintendent and annually review the Superintendent’s performance with reference to those expectations and goals."

According to the BOV Statement of Governance: " It shall define its expectations and set goals for the Superintendent and annually review the Superintendent’s performance with reference to those expectations and goals."

To be clear, I am NOT asking for the actual performance appraisals of either Gen. Peay or Maj. Gen. Wins by the BOV as those would contain personal information. This is only for the objective criteria approved by the BOV, with when and how it was approved, that established those performance criteria upon which evaluations, bonuses, etc. were acted on.

I am willing to take incremental fulfillment of this FOIA so, for example,s the expectations and goals the Superintendent was evaluated on in the recent BOV Special Meeting where the BOV voted not to extend his contract should be available immediately.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: Ventura County Fire Department’s Records for: "any communications made by Ventura County fire department that contain my name"
communications.communication:
Regarding your request for: "any communications made by Ventura County fire department that contain my name". This request is overly broad for the type of records we maintain. Please provide an approximate timeline and location to process your request.



The Ventura County Fire Protection District (VCFPD) is a pre-hospital care provider and is governed by federal and state medical privacy rules and regulations.To obtain a copy of records containing protected health information, or specific individual information, the VCFPD Medical Release form will need to be fully executed.  We do require a legal signature and supporting document verifications; therefore, once the form has been completed and signed, return by following the instructions listed on the form, or a subpoena that includes a Notice to Consumer with proof of service, or court order.



Visit the Ventura County Fire Department’s website: vcfd.org/public-records<https://vcfd.org/public-records>

Select Emergency Response Records WITH Medical Information

Complete the form, noting that all * fields are required.

title: Middle Tenn FRS

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

title: Memphis Scorpion unit files

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Memphis Scorpion unit files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

electronic files on the creation and implementation of the Street Crimes Operation to Restore Peace in Our Neighborhoods" a.k.a SCORPION unit from 2021 to 2023. 

This request includes official documents and files on how the team was constructed and deployed as well as any guidelines, manuals, and instruction documents for officers assigned to the unit. For example, I’d like access to information explaining the squad’s “Standard Operating Procedure”, “Mission Statement”, “Assignments”, “Locations of Deployment”, “Accountability” and any other documents and files pertaining to the creation and evaluation of the unit. 

According to publicly available information, there are documents explaining the creation of a “new” unit, as reported by ABC 24 Memphis on July 5, 2024 (Reference link: https://www.localmemphis.com/article/news/local/internal-documents-raise-questions-on-memphis-police-scorpion-unit-cj-davis-statements/522-e4346729-3936-486e-b5cb-4b352e300836) 

Additionally, publicly available records show that the Memphis Police Department maintains internal “Standard Operating Procedure” documents for specific units, like the 2019 Uniform Patrol Station (Reference link: https://fnolan.com/AO3/UPSSOP_complete.pdf). Therefore, the MPD should have a similar document for the SCORPION unit. 

I would like my above request to be filled in electronic formats (such as .pdf or similar format) whenever possible and if the formats are readily available.

Furthermore, from 2021 - 2023 when the unit was disbanded,  in an Excel file or similar electronic format, please send the following data points regarding the Scorpion Unit: total officer-involved shootings per year, total arrests per year, and total guns seized per year. In a December 3, 2021 update from former Memphis Mayor Jim Strickland, he shared publicly that the SCORPION unit had made 125 felony arrests and recovered 95 weapons. Therefore, the remaining information should be available (Reference link: https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/TNMEMPHIS/bulletins/2ff2916). 

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $100. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of policing tactics in Portland. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 

I request that all future communication be conducted via email or phone call. Whenever possible, I would like the documents that are responsive to my request to be sent through email as well.

I also request a prompt response to this request. State law requires a seven-business-day response time. If you expect a significant delay in responding to or fulfilling this request, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

Public records in Tennessee are defined as “all documents, papers, letters, maps, books, photographs, microfilms, electronic data processing files and output, films, sound recordings, or other material, regardless of physical form or characteristics, made or received pursuant to law or ordinance or in connection with the transaction of official business by any governmental entity.” Tenn. Code Ann. § 10-7-503(a)(1)(A)(i).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: FBI: William Claude "Claudel" Ashe

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: William Claude "Claudel" Ashe
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Bureau records related to one William Claude L Ashe. Ashe (Born September 28th 1925 in South Point, South Carolina - died April 9th 1995 in Alamance, North Carolina) was known to the bureau by numerous aliases, including:

Claud Ash
Oscar Claude L. Ashe
William Claudell Ashe
William Claudel Ashe
David Lee Daniel 
David Lee Daniels 

According to the Social Security Death Index, Ashe had a social security number of: 240307664
According to Volume 28 of FBI's Law Enforcement Bulletin, Ashe had an "FBI Number" of: FBI Number: 2,447,337

According to Volume 28 of the FBI's Law Enforcement Bulletin, Ashe was serving a life sentence for a 1948 shotgun murder in North Carolina, when he escaped prison. Ashe was then a fugitive from justice from September 19th 1955 until he was arrested by agents of the bureau in June 1959 in Punta Gorda, Florida. 

https://www.google.ge/books/edition/FBI_Law_Enforcement_Bulletin/Rv-NMS9zpfUC?hl=en&gbpv=1&dq=William%20Claude%20Ashe&pg=RA3-PP1&printsec=frontcover

This is a request for records about William Claudell Ashe from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Ashe held by the Tampa and Charlotte field offices. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to William Claudel Ashe. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to William Claudel Ashe. 

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Bonnie Campbell

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Bonnie Campbell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 29, 2024
Location: Tulsa, OK (Airport)
Suspect: Bonnie Campbell, 53
Incident Summary:
Bonnie Campbell was arrested for allegedly driving under the influence (DUI) on an airport runway. Air traffic control reported that she was blocking the runway and driving around it. Officers arrived and took her into custody, during which she admitted to drinking prior to and while parked at the airport. Officers also noted that this was the second consecutive day they had received reports of her driving under the influence at the airport.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the DUI call at the airport.
Interacted with and questioned Campbell.
Placed Campbell under arrest and transported her.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: November 6, 2024
Location: Hartford, CT
Suspect: Gisselle Victoria-Gonzalez, 42
Incident Summary:
Victoria-Gonzalez was arrested in Hartford on a warrant for second-degree murder in Florida regarding the disappearance of her roommate, Runyleidy Medina-Pacheco. Authorities in Orlando allege she falsely reported Medina-Pacheco missing in December 2022, and subsequent investigation uncovered evidence of a violent incident at their residence. The bodycam footage reportedly captures officers processing Victoria-Gonzalez and communicating with her through a Spanish translator.

Processed her at the time of arrest.
Interacted with her using a translator.

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Traffic Stop – Trenton Futrell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: April 18, 2024
Suspect: Trenton Futrell
Incident Summary:
Futrell was pulled over for allegedly speeding 10 mph over the limit. After stopping in his driveway, he engaged in a profanity-laced tirade against the responding officer, refusing to provide his driver’s license and becoming increasingly aggressive. The officer called for backup, and after continued noncompliance, Futrell was arrested for resisting arrest. He was transported to jail and later released on bond.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:
Conducted the initial traffic stop.
Responded as backup to the scene.
Were involved in Futrell’s arrest and transport to jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Harun

communications.subject: Re: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Traffic Stop – Trenton Futrell
communications.communication:
Your request for body worn camera video is considered invalid per the
Texas Code of Criminal Procedure Article 2B.0112.  You may resubmit your
request with the required information set forth by the referenced statute
through our Open Records Portal, www.longviewtexas.gov/openrecords.
<http://www.longviewtexas.gov/openrecords.>

To Whom It May Concern,

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2021, 2022, 2023 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sergio Nino

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sergio Nino
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: January 23, 2024
Suspect: Sergio Nino, 16 (at the time of the incident)
Incident Summary:
Officers Kristofer Gries, Blake Willer, and Matthew Smith responded to a call from Nino’s father regarding a family dispute. Bodycam footage reportedly captures officers encouraging Nino’s father to physically discipline him, dismissing allegations of abuse, and making statements such as "Your dad should beat you" and "You have no rights." A confrontation ensued when Officer Willer attempted to take Nino’s phone, resulting in officers using force against him. Nino suffered a broken wrist, facial lacerations requiring stitches, and was subsequently hospitalized. He was charged with aggravated assault, though charges were later dropped.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Spoke with Sergio Nino’s father before engaging with the teenager.
Interacted with Sergio Nino, including advising his father on discipline.
Used force on Nino, leading to his injuries and subsequent arrest.
Transported Nino from the scene to medical facilities or booking.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Nichole Maks

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Nichole Maks
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: July 1, 2023
Location: 600 block of Clark Street, Daytona Beach, FL
Suspect: Nichole Maks, 37
Incident Summary:
Nichole Maks was arrested for the murder of her 79-year-old roommate, Michael Cerasoli. Authorities responded to a fire at the residence, where Cerasoli was found deceased with blunt force trauma and multiple stab wounds. Maks was later located at a restaurant in Holly Hill, where she was found with blood on her clothing and in possession of a knife and hammer. During her post-Miranda interview, she attempted to destroy potential evidence by pouring Diet Mountain Dew on herself. She was charged with second-degree murder, resisting arrest with violence, arson, and tampering with physical evidence.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

First made contact with Nichole Maks.
Took her into custody at the restaurant in Holly Hill.
Transported her to the station and recorded her post-Miranda interview.
Were involved in securing evidence and handling the tampering incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun
